Docs.summary: Represents a that is a composite of the transforms in its .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this class when you want to apply multiple general transforms to single object.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3DGroup> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3DGroup.Clone%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

remarks.format:
## Remarks The inverse of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3DGroup> is created by combining the inverses of its child transforms.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3DGroup.Inverse%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
